problem_text: In the figure, C P is an altitude, C Q is the angle bisector of \angle A C B, and R is the midpoint of A B. Find x if m \angle A P C = 72 + x.
compact_text: In the figure, CP is an altitude, CQ is the angle bisector of \angle ACB, and R is the midpoint of AB. Find x if m \angle APC = 72+x.
annotat_text: In the figure, $\overline{CP}$ is an altitude, $\overline{CQ}$ is the angle bisector of $∠ACB$, and $R$ is the midpoint of $\overline{AB}$. Find  $x$ if $m∠APC=72+x$.
